forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
This evening in Downtown San Francisco, a soft cloak of gray clouds envelopes the sky, heralding a night of mild temperatures that hover around 57 degrees. The gentle west-southwest winds, occasionally gusting up to 26 mph, dance across the city, whispering secrets of the Pacific. The atmosphere bears a hint of the marine layer, lightly veiling the hills and bridging the expanse between urban charm and oceanic mystique. The streets glisten lightly under the fading light, while the distant outline of the Golden Gate flirts with the fading sun, promising an intriguing blend of mystery and allure.

As tomorrow unfolds, the skies will part ever so slightly to reveal patches of blue. By midday, warmth teeters towards 65 degrees, perhaps inviting an afternoon reminiscent of those long-lost summer days, where the sun might peek from behind the clouds, illuminating the streets and the stately architecture. Dress in layers to embrace the coolness of the morning air while preparing for the more agreeable embrace of afternoon sunshine. Whether you find yourself meandering through the Mission District’s vibrant murals or seeking solace in a cozy café in North Beach, tomorrow’s balance of cloud and sun offers the perfect backdrop for reflective strolls or leisurely afternoons spent indoors with a warm drink.
